p.s: The Story Project is non-profit organization that fosters reading , writing and communication skills in middle schools .
If you look around , there are so many that seem to complain that they feel alone in the world and misunderstood .
Some feel unloved and abandoned , or uncared for .
The story project is here to make that difference .
You can be a part of that difference !

item.s: Look approachable .
Have a smile on your face .
Be presentable , focused , and calm .
Try smiling with your eyes .
Be aware of your body language and look open and understanding by uncrossing your arms and keeping a genuine gaze .

figure.rend: Contribute to the Story Project Step 1.jpg

item.s: Ask “ what is your story ? ”
This question comes across as very powerful .
As human beings , we often wonder if anyone is interested in knowing who we truly are .
With the stereotypes we have , so many get lost in this image .
Those 4 words are the most amazing words you can say to someone .
It shows how much you care .
These “ life stories ” are extremely powerful gifts and tools .
They show how everything fits together in life to create this bigger picture .
They reveal what truly matters .
They can give comfort and support .
Looking back on the lives we have , with every detail of our life , feelings , and beliefs , and everything that ever happened to us , it ’s all so beautiful .
Just combining those things together to make a person shows us how empowered we can become .
We can learn so much from each other .
We can learn love , acceptance , and peace when we are at peace with ourselves and everyone around us .
Do your part and ask a simple question .
You might just make someone ’s day .

figure.rend: Contribute to the Story Project Step 2.jpg

item.s: Be prepared to listen .
Attend the conversation by leaning slightly foreword while listening , keep your hands and feet quiet and still , and look interested ( and be interested ) , nodding at the appropriate times .
Keep sufficient eye contact .
Look at the person , however , avoid staring .
Offer feedback .
Repeat what the other person is saying in your own words .
Do not do this for every sentence .
Act natural while following your heart .
Look and be comfortable , and the other person will as well .

figure.rend: Contribute to the Story Project Step 3.jpg

item.s: Put yourself in the shoes of the other person .
Avoid judging him or her .

figure.rend: Contribute to the Story Project Step 4.jpg

item.s: Evaluate .
Look at the prospect of the life story of the person .
Take the lessons that need be learned from the story , as well as the person .
Identify the strengths of him or her and compliment accordingly .
Thank them for sharing .

figure.rend: Contribute to the Story Project Step 5.jpg

item.s: Be prepared to share your story .
The story project is about sharing .
It means making someone feel understood and less alone in the world .

In order to accomplish this , it is important to understand the other person by listening and being attentive ; then sharing some things about yourself and your life , your struggles , and rising above those obstacles .

figure.rend: Contribute to the Story Project Step 6.jpg

item.s: Do not worry if someone does not share there story .
Not all persons would feel comfortable doing so .
Do not hesitate to ask .
